page.title: 04OUR CHURCHES
page.content: Tortington church is a very small church with quite a lot of old graves.In the churchyard there is a large old ram, the ram is there to keep the grass nice and neat so that the people of the church do not have to do the work themselves. When we went to visit Tortington church the church was all locked up we realised that it hadnt been kept as nice as Clymping church. We could tell because the walls were crumbling. The walls were made of flint and were badly weathered. When l touched the weathering it crumbled like talcum powder or chalk. The church at Ford was locked as well. It's a pity that our churches have to be locked up because of vandals.
